summary: Premium, mobile-responsive Maspar sales team portal (HTML/CSS/JS, CodePen-ready) with public viewer + admin upload, glassmorphism UI in updated brand theme (Orange #FAA831 + 70% grey), localStorage-based catalog management, protected viewing for PDFs/videos/images, English-only labels (no Hindi), and a New Arrivals homepage banner uploaded via Admin (1280x720).
architectural_notes: Pure HTML/CSS/JS only; CDN libraries allowed (e.g., PDF.js); must run directly on CodePen.
No server backend; persist catalogs/metadata via LocalStorage.
Content protection is best-effort (disable right-click/drag; no-download UX), not true DRM.
Remove bilingual (English/Hindi) label support and any language toggle; use English-only labels throughout.
Update brand/theme colors to Orange #FAA831 and a 70% grey dominant UI theme (replace prior orange #F15A22 usage).
known_issues: User reports requested UI changes were not applied/visible; verify latest build reflects requested updates (especially theme colors).

existing_features.title: Create a mobile-responsive portal UI with a premium glassmorphism look using Maspar brand colors (Orange #F15A22, Grey #4A4A4A, White), including a header with an orange gradient, minimal layout, and smooth hover/lift + transition animations.

Implement a two-area navigation model: (1) a Public Viewer area that requires no login for sales executives, and (2) an Admin area protected by a simple credential check using username `admin` and password `maspar2026`.

Provide an Admin Upload section that allows adding catalog items (PDFs, videos, images) with an in-form preview, and saving all item metadata (title, bilingual labels, collection, media type, and the media source reference) into LocalStorage (no server persistence).
Display catalog content in the Public Viewer as collection-wise glass cards (e.g., Blaize, Colorart, Bedding, Cushions) and allow browsing by selecting a collection to see its items.
Implement search and filtering in the Public Viewer by collection and by label, supporting bilingual labels (English/Hindi) with a UI language toggle for labels.
Add modal popup viewers (with a clear close button) for each media type: PDF (render first page), video (in-page player), and image (zoom-only viewing).

Apply best-effort content protection behaviors in the Public Viewer and modal viewers by disabling right-click/context menu, drag-to-save on images, and obvious download affordances, while keeping the UI smooth and lightweight.
Use clear English user-facing UI text throughout the app (navigation, buttons, helper text), while still supporting bilingual (English/Hindi) item labels.

Provide a simple initial dataset (seed) stored to LocalStorage on first run (if empty) demonstrating at least one item in each of the collections Blaize, Colorart, Bedding, and Cushions, so the Public Viewer is not empty on first open.

Create a predefined label list based on the uploaded image and make it available to the frontend as a single source of truth. The label list must include: Colorart, Vintage, Hermosa, Rurban, Essentials, Eternal Treasure, Hues, Inhouse, Cotsmere, Little Maspar, Generic, Maspar.

Update the Admin Upload form so admins can select from the predefined labels instead of typing label text manually. Keep bilingual label support: selecting a predefined label should populate the English label field, and the Hindi label field must remain editable so admins can enter/override Hindi when needed.

Remove all Hindi-language label support and make the app English-only for catalog labels (including removing the EN/HI language toggle, removing Hindi label inputs in Admin, and updating search/filtering to use only English labels).
Add a "New Arrivals" banner feature: allow Admin to upload/set a banner image (exact size 1280x720 px) and display it prominently on the Public Viewer home page.
Add an Edit action in the Admin catalog table so Admin can update existing catalog items (title, label, collection, media type, and media source) and save changes to LocalStorage.

Implement label-driven organization updates in Admin: provide a way to assign each predefined label to a collection and add a "Category" field under labels (so Admin can set/edit a category for a label). Use this configuration as the single source of truth when creating/editing items.

Update the global theme tokens so the app primary brand color is Orange #FAA831 (replacing any remaining #F15A22) and the overall look is a grey-dominant ("70% grey") glassmorphism theme, while keeping orange as the accent for key UI emphasis (rings, active states, highlights).

Ensure the updated theme changes are actually reflected in the deployed build by removing/avoiding hardcoded color values in component classNames where they override theme tokens, and by relying on the CSS variables/theme tokens for all primary/secondary/accent styling.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build premium Maspar sales portal UI (glassmorphism, minimal, brand colors, header gradient, hover/transition animations)
Admin login (admin/maspar2026) with admin-only upload section and file preview
Public viewer tab for sales team (no login) to browse catalogs, videos, and images
Collection-wise organization and cards (e.g., Blaize, Colorart, Bedding, Cushions) with modal popup viewers
Protected media viewing: PDF first-page viewer (PDF.js), video no-download player, image zoom-only; disable right-click/drag
Persist uploaded content and metadata in LocalStorage (no server)
Mobile responsive layout optimized for field sales phone usage
Provide predefined label set and let Admin assign/select collections based on labels (label-driven collection organization)
Add “New Arrivals” section: Admin uploads a 1280x720 banner and it displays on the home page
Admin Actions section: add an Edit option to modify existing catalog items/metadata
Update labeling model: admin can assign labels↔collections mapping and add a category field under labels
Update seed/sample data and any existing stored catalog compatibility handling so the app continues to work after switching to English-only labels and introducing label category mapping.
Update UI theme to use orange (#FAA831) with a 70% grey overall theme across the portal

Audit and fix any UI elements that still visually render with the old orange theme or inconsistent greys, ensuring the updated orange + grey theme is applied consistently across the Header, Tabs navigation, Collection cards, Search/Filters panel, Item grid cards, and the Media viewer modal.
